parameters.name: X-Compute-Request-ID
parameters.description: Returns a unique identifier to provide tracking for the request. The request-id associated with the request appears in the log lines for that request. By default, the middleware configuration ensures the request_id appears in the log files.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the server as a string; can be queried with regular expressions. Realize that ?name=bob returns both bob and bobb. If you need to match bob only, you can use a regular expression matching the syntax of the underlying database server implemented for Compute (such as MySQL or PostgreSQL).

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description: UUID of the server at which you want to set a marker.

parameters.name: servers
parameters.description: List of servers.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Moves to the next metadata item.

parameters.name: previous
parameters.description: Moves to the previous metadata item.

parameters.name: security_groups
parameters.description: A security_groups object.

parameters.name: security_group
parameters.description: One or more security_group objects. Specify the name of the security group in the name attribute. If you omit this attribute, the server is created in the default security group.

parameters.name: user_data
parameters.description: Configuration information or scripts to use upon launch. Must be Base64 encoded.

parameters.name: availability_zone
parameters.description: The availability zone in which to launch the server.

parameters.name: server
parameters.description: server.

parameters.name: imageRef
parameters.description:
The image reference for the desired image for your server instance.

Specify as an ID or full URL.

parameters.name: flavorRef
parameters.description:
The flavor reference for the desired flavor for your server instance.

Specify as an ID or full URL.

parameters.name: networks
parameters.description:
A networks object. By default, the server instance is provisioned with all isolated networks for the tenant.

Optionally, you can create one or more NICs on the server.

To provision the server instance with a NIC for a nova-network network, specify the UUID in the uuid attribute in a networks object.

To provision the server instance with a NIC for a neutron network, specify the UUID in the port attribute in a networks object.

You can specify multiple NICs on the server.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: To provision the server instance with a NIC for a nova-network network, specify the UUID in the uuid attribute in a networks object. Required if you omit the port attribute.

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: To provision the server instance with a NIC for a neutron network, specify the UUID in the port attribute in a networks object. Required if you omit the uuid attribute.

parameters.name: fixed_ip
parameters.description: A fixed IPv4 address for the NIC. Valid with a neutron or nova-networks network.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The server name.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Metadata key and value pairs. The maximum size of the metadata key and value is 255 bytes each.

parameters.name: personality
parameters.description: File path and contents (text only) to inject into the server at launch. The maximum size of the file path data is 255 bytes. The maximum limit refers to the number of bytes in the decoded data and not the number of characters in the encoded data.

parameters.name: config_drive
parameters.description:
Enables metadata injection in a server through a configuration drive.

To enable a configuration drive, specify true. Otherwise, specify false.
